definition: to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column
palace/temple/castration (as corporal punishment)/first note in pentatonic scale

sentences.english: Empress Dowager of the palace and gardens from the withers not a dewy rose.
sentences.chinese: 皇太后的花园及行宫是从不曾凋谢的一支带露玫瑰。

sentences.english: I saw your face in a crowded p(a)lace.
sentences.chinese: 我见到你容颜，在拥挤的行宫里。

sentences.english: And now I am on my way to the palace ofthe chieftain of the Tujia nationality, which is particularly famous in Furong Town.
sentences.chinese: 我现在要去的就是当地芙蓉镇特别有名的土王行宫。

sentences.english: The south side is the main hall, the main building for days after the palace.
sentences.chinese: 山门南面是大殿，为天后行宫的主体建筑。

sentences.english: Beijing was the winter capital for what well-known ruler?
sentences.chinese: 北京曾是哪位著名统治者的冬季行宫所在地？

sentences.english: And he made darkness pavilions round about him, dark waters, and thick clouds of the skies.
sentences.chinese: 他以黑暗和聚集的水，天空的厚云为他四围的行宫。

definition: Imperial City, inner part of Beijing, with the Forbidden City at its center
main hall of a Buddhist temple
main hall of a Buddhist temple
underground palace (as part of imperial tomb)
